meanings.definition: To uncover or dig up something buried in the ground.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist was inearthing ancient artifacts from the ruins.
meanings.sent2: The gardener was inearthing potatoes from the soil.
meanings.sent3: The dog was inearthing buried bones in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The detective inearthed crucial evidence from the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The children inearthed a time capsule filled with memories.

meanings.definition: To reveal or bring to light something hidden or secret.
meanings.sent1: The journalist was inearthing corruption within the government.
meanings.sent2: The historian was inearthing forgotten stories from the past.
meanings.sent3: The magician inearthed a rabbit from the hat unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The hacker inearthed sensitive information from the database.
meanings.sent5: The explorer inearthed a treasure map leading to riches.
